snippet: As students, alumni and faculty members call on Yale to rename a residential college named for the white supremacist John C. Calhoun, the university weighs whether to expunge such displays of its history.
abstract: Yale University is facing mounting pressure from students, alumni and faculty to change name of Calhoun College, which is named after white supremacist John C Calhoun; massacre in Charleston, SC, and removal of Confederate flag from South Carolina State House have reignited debate, and even drawn attention to practice of calling heads of colleges 'masters.'
lead_paragraph: As students, alumni and faculty members call on Yale to rename a residential college named for the white supremacist John C. Calhoun, the university weighs whether to expunge such displays of its history.

headline.main: Yale Grapples With Ties to Slavery in Debate Over a College’s Name
headline.print_headline: Yale Grapples With Ties to Slavery in a Debate Over a College’s Name
